instructions.name: close_key_recovery
docs: Closes all recovery-related accounts.

instructions.name: dummy_instruction
docs: Only present so the mempool and execpool accounts are actually included in the idl, since we
don't explicitly declare them in the accounts section of the other instructions.

accounts.name: comp_def_raw
docs: At least the first raw circuit account must exist before finalizing

instructions.name: finalize_key_recovery_callback
docs: Callback for key_recovery_finalize computation.

instructions.name: finalize_key_recovery_execution
docs: Finalizes the key recovery execution after threshold is met and queues the computation.

accounts.name: mempool
docs: function

instructions.name: init_computation_definition
docs: Initializes a computation definition.

accounts.name: signer
docs: Signer of the transaction.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: System program account.

instructions.name: init_key_recovery_execution_part1
docs: Part 1 of key recovery execution initialization.
Creates the MxeRecoveryAccount with partial size due to Solana's 10KB limit.
Call init_key_recovery_execution_part2 afterwards.

accounts.name: mxe_recovery_account
docs: Full allocation happens in init_key_recovery_execution_part2.

instructions.name: init_key_recovery_execution_part2
docs: Part 2 of key recovery execution initialization.
Finishes allocating MxeRecoveryAccount and creates the computation definition.

accounts.name: key_recovery_finalize_comp_def
docs: The computation definition account for MxeKeyRecoveryFinalize (on backup MXE)

instructions.name: init_mxe_part1
docs: Initializes a MPC Execution Environment (part 1).
Due to Solana's 10KB per-instruction allocation limit, this only partially
allocates recovery_cluster_acc. Call init_mxe_part2 afterwards to finish
allocation and add keygen to mempool.

accounts.name: signer
docs: Signer of the transaction.

accounts.name: recovery_cluster_acc
docs: Full allocation happens in init_mxe_part2.

accounts.name: mxe_program
docs: constraint in tests because setting it would require us to deploy a program each time.

accounts.name: system_program
docs: System program account.

instructions.name: init_mxe_part2
docs: Finishes MXE initialization (part 2).
Reallocates recovery_cluster_acc to full size, initializes recovery_peers,
and adds the keygen computation to the mempool.

accounts.name: cluster
docs: Cluster to add to the MXE.

accounts.name: mxe
docs: MXE account to initialize.

accounts.name: mxe_program
docs: constraint in tests because setting it would require us to deploy a program each time.

accounts.name: program_data
docs: The seeds constraint is only applied in non-testing builds.

instructions.name: queue_computation
docs: Queues a computation.
cu_price_micro: The priority price of a CU, in thousandths of lamports. Used
to calculate the priority fee and rounded down.

accounts.name: sign_seed
docs: This is ok-ish though, as we're just reading the bump to verify the PDA.

instructions.name: queue_key_recovery_init
docs: Queues the key recovery init computation for the MXE.
Can only be called once after MXE keys are set.

instructions.name: reclaim_expired_computation_fee
docs: Reclaim fees for an expired computation that was never executed.

instructions.name: recover_mxe
docs: Sets an MXE to the Recovery state, enabling the recovery process to begin.

instructions.name: requeue_key_recovery_finalize
docs: Re-queues the key_recovery_finalize computation after a failed execution.

accounts.name: previous_computation
docs: The previous failed computation account

instructions.name: requeue_mxe_keygen
docs: Re-queues the MXE keygen computation if it has expired from the mempool.
This allows retrying the keygen if it wasn't processed in time.

accounts.name: signer
docs: Signer of the transaction.

accounts.name: mxe
docs: MXE account to set the cluster for.

accounts.name: cluster
docs: Cluster to set for the MXE.

instructions.name: submit_key_recovery_share
docs: Submits a recovery share from a recovery peer.
Each share contains RESCUE_KEY_COUNT (5) field elements of 32 bytes each.

errors.name: MxeKeysAlreadySet
errors.msg: The MXE keys are already set, i.e. all the nodes of the MXE cluster already agreed on the MXE keys

errors.name: MxeKeysNotSet
errors.msg: The MXE keys are not set, i.e. not all the nodes of the MXE cluster agreed on the MXE keys

errors.name: InvalidMXE
errors.msg: An invalid MXE account has been supplied

errors.name: InvalidCluster
errors.msg: An invalid cluster account has been supplied

errors.name: InvalidComputationDefinition
errors.msg: An invalid computation definition account has been supplied

errors.name: CantFindMempoolID
errors.msg: Couldn't find a mempool ID for the computation

errors.name: ComputationNotExpired
errors.msg: Computation has not expired from mempool yet

errors.name: MaxClusterMembershipReached
errors.msg: Maximum number of nodes in the cluster has been reached

errors.name: NodeAlreadyExists
errors.msg: The node already exists in the cluster

errors.name: NodeInActiveCluster
errors.msg: Node is in an active cluster

errors.name: UnauthorizedNodeCreation
errors.msg: Unauthorized to create node on mainnet

errors.name: InvalidSlot
errors.msg: Current slot is before the last updated slot

errors.name: InvalidLighthouseInstructionCount
errors.msg: Invalid number of Lighthouse program instructions

errors.name: NotAllNodesVotedForBlsPublicKey
errors.msg: Not all nodes have voted for the BLS public key

errors.name: MustNotBeCalledViaCpi
errors.msg: This instruction must be called directly, not via CPI

errors.name: MxeNotInRecoveryState
errors.msg: MXE is not in recovery state

errors.name: MxeAlreadyInRecovery
errors.msg: MXE is already in recovery state

errors.name: BackupKeygenNotComplete
errors.msg: Backup MXE keygen is not complete

errors.name: RecoveryAuthorityMismatch
errors.msg: Authority mismatch between original and backup MXE

errors.name: InvalidRecoveryPeerOffset
errors.msg: Invalid peer offset for recovery share submission

errors.name: NotRecoveryPeer
errors.msg: Signer is not a valid recovery peer

errors.name: RecoveryComputationNotFailed
errors.msg: Previous computation did not fail, cannot requeue

errors.name: RecoveryActiveComputationExists
errors.msg: Cannot close recovery with active computation

errors.name: BackupClusterNotSet
errors.msg: Backup MXE cluster is not set

fields.name: activation_epoch
docs: epoch for the cluster was activated. Epoch::INFINITY if inactive.

fields.name: deactivation_epoch
docs: epoch for the cluster to be deactivated. Epoch::INFINITY if none.

types.name: ArgumentList
docs: Container for arguments that separates small inline values from large indexed data

types.name: ArgumentRef
docs: A reference to an argument - stores small values that don't affect alignment inline and large
values as indices.

fields.name: x25519_pubkey
docs: X25519 public key for usage when being a key recovery peer. MUST BE AT byte index 8 - 40

fields.name: cluster_membership
docs: The offsets of the cluster the node is a member of.

fields.name: bls_pubkey
docs: BLS public key for this node (64 bytes compressed G2 point for alt-bn128)

fields.name: authority
docs: Admin key for node management operations

fields.name: callback_authority
docs: Key used to sign computation callbacks - separated for operational security

types.name: CallbackAccount
docs: A callback account to be provided to a computation.
We don't specify signer, since node operators can't sign.

types.name: CallbackInstruction
docs: A custom callback instruction with its own program ID and discriminator.

types.name: ClockAccount
docs: An account storing the current network epoch

fields.name: cu_price
docs: The price of compute units in this cluster.

fields.name: cu_price_proposals
docs: The proposals for the cu price proposals in the next epoch.
Index 0 is always the current price, we allow `MAX_FEE_PROPS` at most.

fields.name: last_updated_epoch
docs: The epoch this cluster was last updated.
Used to determine if the cluster needs to be updated.

fields.name: bls_public_key
docs: BLS public key for the cluster (64 bytes compressed G2 point for alt-bn128)
Set only when all nodes have submitted and agreed on the aggregated pubkey

types.name: ComputationAccount
docs: A computation execution call to a [super::mxe::ComputationDefinitionAccount].

fields.name: mxe_program_id
docs: The program ID of the MXE that this computation is associated with.

fields.name: computation_definition_offset
docs: The offset of the corresponding [super::mxe::ComputationDefinitionAccount].

fields.name: execution_fee
docs: The execution fee for the execution.

fields.name: cluster_index
docs: The MXE's cluster to be used for execution.
# Notes
- [None] represents the default cluster,
- [Some] specifies the index of the fallback cluster.

types.name: ComputationDefinitionAccount
docs: An account representing a [ComputationDefinition] in a MXE.

fields.name: finalization_authority
docs: The authority that is allowed to finalize a computation execution (callback).
This is distinct from `upload_auth` (in `OnChainCircuitSource`) which controls the
computation definition lifecycle (uploading/finalizing the definition itself).
If set to None, anyone can finalize the computation execution.

fields.name: cu_amount
docs: The amount of CUs this computation will use.

fields.name: definition
docs: The interface of the computation to execute.

fields.name: circuit_source
docs: Where to fetch the actual raw circuit to execute.

types.name: ComputationDefinitionMeta
docs: A computation definition for execution in a MXE.

fields.name: compiled_circuit
docs: The length here is meaningless.

types.name: ComputationSignature
docs: The signature of a computation defined in a [ComputationDefinition].

fields.name: parameters
docs: The input parameters of the computation.

fields.name: outputs
docs: The output(s) of the computation.

types.name: Epoch
docs: The network epoch

fields.name: base_fee
docs: The base fee for the computation.

fields.name: priority_fee
docs: The additional fee to enforce priortized execution in the mempool.

fields.name: output_delivery_fee
docs: A fee for output delivery fees (i.e. tx fees).

fields.name: valid_bits
docs: Bit array tracking which slots are valid (1 = valid, 0 = stale)
1 bit per slot, packed into bytes. For $buffer_length=180, this is 23 bytes.

types.name: MXEAccount
docs: A MPC Execution Environment.

fields.name: cluster
docs: The cluster executing the MXE.

fields.name: keygen_offset
docs: The offset used for the keygen computation account.
Stored so requeue_mxe_keygen can find the computation account.

fields.name: key_recovery_init_offset
docs: The offset used for the key recovery init computation account.
Stored so queue_key_recovery_init can find the computation account.

fields.name: mxe_program_id
docs: The program ID of the program that this MXE is associated with. Needed so that when we
index this account offchain we can find out what program it is associated with.

fields.name: authority
docs: The management authority of the MXE.

fields.name: utility_pubkeys
docs: The utility pubkeys, consisting of
- x25519 pubkey (32 bytes), used for key exchange
- ed25519 verifying key (32 bytes), used for signature verification
- ElGamal pubkey (32 bytes), used for c-spl
- ElGamal pubkey validity proof (64 bytes), used for c-spl

fields.name: fallback_clusters
docs: Fallback clusters that can execute this MXE as an alternative to the
[MXEAccount::cluster]. There can be a maximum of [MAX_FALLBACK_CLUSTERS]
fallback clusters.

fields.name: rejected_clusters
docs: The clusters that have rejected this MXE.

fields.name: computation_definitions
docs: The offsets of all [ComputationDefinitionAccount]s of this MXE.

fields.name: status
docs: The status of this MXE (Active or Recovery).

fields.name: valid_bits
docs: Bit array tracking which slots are valid (1 = valid, 0 = stale)
1 bit per slot, packed into bytes. For $buffer_length=180, this is 23 bytes.

types.name: MxeRecoveryAccount
docs: Account for tracking key recovery execution state.
PDA seeds: ["mxe_recovery", backup_mxe_pubkey, original_mxe_pubkey]

fields.name: key_recovery_finalize_offset
docs: The computation offset for the queued key_recovery_finalize circuit.

fields.name: shares
docs: The shares submitted by recovery peers. Each peer submits RESCUE_KEY_COUNT (5) field
elements. Each field element is 32 bytes. Zeros indicate not yet uploaded.

fields.name: is_finalized
docs: Whether the recovery has been finalized (threshold met and marked ready).

fields.name: _padding2
docs: Padding to ensure struct size is u64 aligned (6 bytes)

types.name: MxeStatus
docs: The status of an MXE.

types.name: NodeMetadata
docs: location as [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code

fields.name: ip
docs: [Ipv4Addr], represented by it's 4 octects

fields.name: peer_id
docs: Needed for MPC protocol

types.name: NodeRef
docs: A reference to a node in the cluster.
The offset is to derive the Node Account.
The current_total_rewards is the total rewards the node has received so far in the current
epoch.

fields.name: current_total_rewards
docs: Current total rewards the node has received in the current epoch in lamports.

fields.name: is_completed
docs: Specifies if the circuit for this computation has been fully uploaded,
as this can take multiple transactions due to the circuit size.

fields.name: upload_auth
docs: The authority that is allowed to upload circuit data and finalize the computation
definition. This controls the definition lifecycle, distinct from
`finalization_authority` (in `ComputationDefinitionAccount`) which controls computation
execution finalization.

types.name: OperatorMeta
docs: location as [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://www.iso.org/iso-3166-country-codes.html) country code

fields.name: url
docs: URL should point to a JSON containing the following fields:
- `name`: String, the name of the operator
- `description`: String, a description of the operator
- `icon`: String, a URL to an icon representing the operator
- `url`: String, a URL to the operator's website

types.name: Output
docs: An output of a computation.
We currently don't support encrypted outputs yet since encrypted values are passed via
data objects.

types.name: Parameter
docs: A parameter of a computation.
We differentiate between plaintext and encrypted parameters and data objects.
Plaintext parameters are directly provided as their value.
Encrypted parameters are provided as an offchain reference to the data.
Data objects are provided as a reference to the data object account.

fields.name: recovery_peers
docs: The offsets of nodes in our key recovery cluster. 0 means null in this context.
DO NOT PUT ANYTHING BEFORE THE RECOVERY_PEERS FIELD, IT'S EXPECTED TO BE AT OFFSET 8.

types.name: SetUnset
docs: Utility struct to store a value that needs to be set by a certain number of participants (keys
in our case). Once all participants have set the value, the value is considered set and we only
store it once.

fields.name: valid_bits
docs: Bit array tracking which slots are valid (1 = valid, 0 = stale)
1 bit per slot, packed into bytes. For $buffer_length=180, this is 23 bytes.

fields.name: valid_bits
docs: Bit array tracking which slots are valid (1 = valid, 0 = stale)
1 bit per slot, packed into bytes. For $buffer_length=180, this is 23 bytes.
